page.title: 05Industrial Survey
page.content: Rishton is a town which developed with the growth of the Lancashire textile industry. Mills were built alongside the canal for easy transport- ation of goods. In 1985 nothing is left of the textile industry and very little of the mills. These have been replaced by light industry housed in converted or prefabricated premises and employing few workers. The largest area of employment is the retail trade, with shops in the High Street. There is also a large pet food manufacturer, a carpet factory and a timber yard as well as several service industries. Most of the industry is located near the town centre but recently there has been a move back towards the canal.
